intro: Satyria meiantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved satyria, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in clusters. The plant has ovate to elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
